title: 1964 Chevrolet Corvette

description: This 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible is the perfect mix of vintage and upgrades.  It's a great-looking droptop has been updated with a stellar red paint, restored interior, and performance components added to the numbers-matching V8.  And if that wasn't enough, who can resist the allure of a stick shift Stingray?

Red Corvettes are so iconic that they write songs about them.  And this car truly knows how to inspire a tune.  That's because there has been an investment in 1970-correct Monza Red to give this classic color a modern shine.  That means sunlight rolls off the shark-like nose and tall fenders so evenly that you can't help but attract attention.  In fact, you truly get to choose the attitude you want to share with the world by selecting between the aggressive new black soft top or slick red hard top whenever you want (and if it's original like we suspect, you know it's quite rare!) The early C3 cars are the ones to own because of all the great brightwork.  On a properly presented '70 like this one, that means nicely integrated chrome bumpers, bright rocker panes, and iconic Rally wheels.

Inside, the correct saddle tan leather interior looks great against the red paint.  You can instantly tell by the condition of the bucket seats, door panels, carpeting, and dash that there has been a nice investment in keeping this looking its best.  Corvettes have always been a great personal sports car by providing a nice mix of performance features and plenty of creature comforts, and this one does it right.  You get a three-spoke steering wheel that gives you a commanding view of the large dual pod gauges for the speedo and tach.  Just to the side are a full set of auxiliary readouts for all your vital info.  Below that are the heat/defrost controls and an upgraded AM/FM stereo that includes an aux input for the most modern music players.  But we really know your favorite feature is the stick shift that lets you get the most out of this Stingray.

This is a car that's made to show off, so even the engine bay doesn't disappoint.  Lift the hood to see a nicely detailed package with plenty of shine.  The polished valve covers, master cylinder, alternator, and much more all mean you'll lover showing this one off.  And while this is thoroughly upgraded, you'll also be delighted to tell people that it's the original, numbers-matching V8.  Chevy's trusty 350 now has performance enhancements such as a Quick Fuel four-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake, steel braded hoses, Be Cool aluminum radiator, and long tube headers that feed the rumbling dual exhaust.  Best of all, you have complete control over the upgraded motor and its thunderous soundtrack thanks to the Muncie M20 four-speed transmission.  This car was made for taking the long way home, and components like the fully independent sports suspension, power steering, and four-wheel disc brakes prove that this custom Corvette is a great all-around driving classic.
title: 1970 Chevrolet Corvette

description: 1971 Chevrolet Corvette Coupe For Sale NUMBERS MATCHING 350/270 HP V8, 4-SPEED MUNCIE, SIDE PIPES, T- TOPS, PS, PB! This 1971 Corvette hits all the high notes: a matching-numbers small block V8, vivid Mille Miglia Red paint, and a very attractive price tag. While the early Stingrays with 427s get all the attention, if you're looking for a great-running 'Vette with a 4-speed and side pipes that doesn't foul its plugs in traffic, this is the hot ticket.The body on this Stingray still looks awesome even after all these years. There are few cars that will attract more attention than a C3 and definitely none that are more widely recognized. Roll up in this fantastic plastic and EVERYBODY notices. Of course, it doesn't hurt that the bodywork is super straight, with excellent prep over well- preserved original fiberglass that has never been damaged. Mille Miglia Red seems like the archetypal Corvette color today, but in 1971 it was only the fifth most popular color, which is surprising, don't you think? Either way, it looks simply spectacular. Gaps are about as good as you can get on an untouched original C3 and most Stingray fans prefer the chrome bumpers to the later urethane units. And speaking of brightwork, the bumpers are in great shape, the stainless is polished, all the Stingray script emblems are in place, and there's nothing quite like an early Corvette with shiny chrome side pipes. You want American performance in fiberglass, this is definitely it. This car's fastidious care throughout its life is most evident inside, where the original black interior is in excellent condition. The seat covers are brand new and comfortable and the woven inserts remain comfortable even on hot days. The carpets are similarly excellent, and the door panels match the seats with a comfortable, lived-in look. Other goodies include a brand new modern AM/FM stereo and those cool fiber- optic bulb indicators in the console, which would disappear after 1971. And yes, that's a 4-speed manual shifter in the center console, making the '71 'Vette a somewhat rare find. This car will also eat lesser machines on the road, thanks to the original, numbers-matching 350 cubic inch V8 under the hood. With a stout 270 horsepower, it's the smart choice for the guy who likes to drive his Corvette, because it's not only quick, it's a combination that was perfected decades ago. Reliable and virtually indestructible, the engines wide torque band makes it the ideal power plant for long-distance cruising. Nicely detailed with correct Chevy Orange paint on the block, the original air cleaner with chrome lid, and fresh plugs, wires, and hoses, its ready to rumble. The 4- speed Muncie transmission is the perfect dance partner, and it feeds a set of highway-friendly gears out back, so this Corvette is a joy on the highway with plenty of punch at any speed. The rumbling dual exhaust system sounds spectacular blowing through those side pipes and the Rally wheels wear 235/70/15 BFGoodrich T/A radials. An awesome survivor, this pretty red Corvette is begging for a long road trip this summer. description: The 1978 Corvettes came in with a bang, being the most extensively redesigned model in a decade. The fastback rear styling was not a hatchback, but allowed for more luggage space behind the seats. The luggage area was significantly larger and included a retractable cover that added security and sun protection. This model year also added a glove box, new armrests, new inner door panels, a redesigned speedometer and tach, and wiper and washer controls were moved back to the instrument panel. This particular Corvette has the L82 engine, a 350 with 220hp, an upgrade to the 350/185hp that was standard. Most of this car is totally original to the car-including the paint. It has 43K actual miles, and must have been kept in the garage, because it is in excellent condition for its age. It drives and handles exceptionally well, and had lots of options that make it a great driving experience. Two-tone silevr exterior Black cloth interior Aluminum wheels Goodyear Eagle ST tires crusie control power steering, brakes and windows Tilt and telescoping steering wheel Solid panel T-tops AM/FM radio with cassette New Calipers, Brakes, Rear Spring, Battery, Rear Spindles and Exhaust. Rebuilt carburetor and distributor.
